Bloomberg [Rumor]: $AAPL is expected to host its first major event of this year sometime in March or April - expected iPhone SE (2) 5G launch.

It will be powered by the Apple A15 processor along w/ 3GB of RAM - Same design as the 2020 model w/ a 4.7" screen. 

There could also be a Plus variant that will pack 4GB of RAM w/ a 5.7" or 6.1" screen. 

Further, major update will come in 2024 when iPhone SE (3) adopts XR/11 style.

JP Morgan claims that the upcoming iPhone SE could lure nearly 1.4B low to mid-range Android phone users as well as about 300M older iPhone model users.

FYI, Jan 9 was the 15th anniversary since Apple CEO Steve Jobs stood on stage at the Macworld Expo in San Francisco, California & gave the world its first look at the iPhone. "An iPod, a phone and internet communicator. An iPod, a phone, are you getting it?"

https://mashable.com/article/first-iphone-keynote-15-year-anniversary
